February 13, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
This is to inform you of the resignation of Doctor Juan
Guiteras from the Yellow Fever Council. Two letters from him,
dated December 28, 1922 and January 17, 1923 submitting his resig-
nation have been received. The resignation was presented at the
meeting of the Executive Committee held on February 6, 1923, and
with reluctance the Committee voted to accept it. At the same time
they adopted the following resolution:

“Resolved that the Board hereby express its apprecia-
tion of the services of Dr. Juan Guiteras
as a member of the Yellow Fever Council
and its regret that he is no longer in a
position to continue the significant contri-
bution which has been made by his broad ex-
perience and sound judgment toward the elim-
ination of yellow fever from the western
hemisphere.”

Copies of the correspondence enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3; enc. 4 with Doctor Guiteras are
enclosed.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H. R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D. C.
